meanings.definition: To officially make someone a priest or minister.
meanings.sent1: The bishop will be ordaining the new priest at the cathedral.
meanings.sent2: The church will be ordaining several new ministers next Sunday.
meanings.sent3: Ordaining a priest involves a special ceremony with lots of singing and praying.
meanings.sent4: The act of ordaining a minister is like bestowing a sacred blessing upon them.
meanings.sent5: The community gathered to witness the ordaining of their beloved pastor.

meanings.sent1: The king will be ordaining a new law to protect the environment.
meanings.sent2: The government is ordaining stricter regulations for food safety.
meanings.sent3: Ordaining a mandatory curfew seemed like a drastic measure to some.
meanings.sent4: The decree ordaining the ban on plastic bags surprised many citizens.
meanings.sent5: The council's decision to ordain the new policy was met with mixed reactions.

meanings.sent1: The company will be ordaining a new CEO to lead its expansion.
meanings.sent2: The board of directors is ordaining a committee to review the budget.
meanings.sent3: Ordaining a new rule for office etiquette brought some relief to the employees.
meanings.sent4: The council's vote to ordain the new regulation was unanimous.
meanings.sent5: The mayor's speech about ordaining a brighter future for the city was inspiring.
